channel.title: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]
channel.description:
Some of my admins and some of my players keep accusing people of things. The admins are accusing people of things that are un-allowed such as autoing. Then, the admins stories don't match the ones of the players. The players said the admins were muting and jailing them and i have NO IDEA what to believe. I know some servers have this...so, I would like to record what commands are said. Like what player used them and what command they used!
HELP PLEASE!

item.title: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

imsuperman05:

nah PI doesnt record commands… your prob thinking of delta

Mine did.

All the above posts are useful, so I’d recommend what they said.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]
item.dc:creator: @ravens ravens
item.description:
@ravens wrote:

chances are your server already logs commands. go to your source -> data-> commands.txt or commands2.txt whichever one

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]

item.title: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Bandos1337 Bandos1337
item.description:
@Bandos1337 wrote:

If Config.SERVER_DEBUG is on, it logs, so…
Search in commands.java for Misc.println(c.playerName+" playerCommand: "+playerCommand);
It should be near the top. On the line right below that one put

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] i really need to know how to record the commands used [pi]

item.description:

Uhm i’m taking a stab at this, but you can maybe edit chat logs or ban logs to keep a record of commands, maybe experiment a little bit with it.
